articles.author: Andrew Woodcock
articles.title: Majority of voters back rail strikes and think Boris Johnson not doing enough to prevent them
articles.description: A majority of voters think this week’s rail strikes are justified and two-thirds (66 per cent) think the government has not done enough to prevent them happening, according to a new poll.
articles.content:
A majority of voters think this weeks rail strikes are justified and two-thirds (66 per cent) think the government has not done enough to prevent them happening, according to a new poll.

articles.content:

articles.title: ‘More pigeons than people’: Empty train stations across the UK as rail strike cripples services
articles.description: Deserted platforms and packed double-deckers on the first day of train strike
articles.content:
Train stations across the UK have been deserted on the first day of major rail strikes.

articles.title: The annual Yulin dog-eating festival has begun – yes, you read that right

articles.title: Boris Johnson says workers should accept a pay cut to avoid spiralling inflation – is he right?
